title: AMD drivers are bricking Windows 11 systems...again
description: AMD's latest Radeon drivers may be causing major issues for some systems, even corrupting the Windows 11 install itself.

title: North Korean hackers target phones, Windows devices with new malware
description: New malware can scan for connected mobile devices and steal data from those, as well.

title: Popular pirate Z-library relaunches with new personal domains
description: Z-library decentralizes domains in hopes of avoiding getting shut down again by US law enforcement.

title: WhatsApp Android app gets some small but very useful changes
description: WhatsApp has witnessed some smart additions on Android, including the ability to share a ton of pics in chats.

title: Apple Pay Later could make you qualify for its limited financial help
description: Apple Pay Later could finally launch soon, but the financial service's qualifying rules mean it might not be available to everyone.

title: OnePlus's next cheap wireless earbuds don't look that different from its last pair
description: The OnePlus Nord 2 earbuds looks set to be pretty similar to their predecessors in terms of battery and design.

title: These NPM tools are actually just install malware
description: More than a dozen typosquatted packages discovered on NPM distributing crypto miners.

title: ChatGPT searchbots are broken, can NeevaAI fix it?
description: Now available for users in the US, Canada, the UK, Germany, France and Spain, can NeevaAI really solve the ChatGPT search conundrum?

title: GitHub Copilot for business is here, using OpenAI to solve your programming worries
description: AI coding tool can now be licensed for entire firms - with some new upgrades for GitHub Copilot also on the way.

title: The Oppo Find N2 Flip has landed, and it’s far cheaper than the Galaxy Z Flip 4
description: The Oppo Find N2 Flip is one of the cheapest foldable phones yet, while its specs are among the best.

title: Microsoft unveils fixes for more critical security flaws, so patch now
description: Microsoft's February Patch Tuesday release is upon us, fixing three zero-days among other things.

title: Sony reportedly working on PS5 earbuds that could rival Apple Airpods
description: New wireless earphones specifically engineered for the PS5 could be coming in the next year.

title: IKEA’s new smart sensor could be the key to making your home healthier
description: IKEA's latest smart home accessory is a Matter-compatible air quality sensor that could help make your home a lot healthier.

title: Google Workspace is apparently the best choice for keeping your workplace secured
description: A four-year study recommends cloud-based email over on-prem as more secure solutions.

title: Bing’s ChatGPT-powered search engine is making stuff up and throwing tantrums
description: A week into its public release Bing's ChatGPT powered search engine is not having a good time, and neither are its users.

title: If it ever comes, Apple’s first foldable iPhone may ditch physical buttons entirely
description: A new patent suggests Apple is working on developing a touch-sensitive iPhone chassis.

title: Google's Privacy Sandbox initiative won’t save you from web tracking
description: Google’s new toolset has a flashy title, but ultimately, you’re still the product.

title: It's finally game over for one of Windows 11's oldest (and annoying) bugs
description: This is an odd bug, and you really won’t believe how long it has taken for Microsoft to cure the glitch.

title: Oppo Find X6 Pro all but confirmed to charge much faster than its predecessor
description: A certification listing confirms that the upcoming Oppo flagship has 100W charging, but Oppo could do even better.

title: Microsoft kills off the enterprise social network no-one remembered it has
description: Yammer was acquired for nearly $1.2bn a decade ago, but is now being rolled into Microsoft Viva.

title: Marvel is making big changes to its stuffed TV show lineup – and it needs to
description: Marvel President Kevin Feige has admitted that the studio needs to alter its approach to TV output.

title: Microsoft is ready to make your Internet Explorer separation complete
description: As part of a new Edge update, Microsoft is permanently disabling Internet Explorer on Windows 10 forever.
